summary: This FBI report documents a meeting on September 18, 2019, with a DVR vendor to investigate catastrophic disk failures in a surveillance system. The technical review concluded no recordings were available after July 29, 2019, and found no evidence of a system rebuild.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: A DVR vendor representative from SigNet Technologies who provided an overview of the system operation during an FBI investigation.

persons.name: David Loveall
persons.context: Reviewed DVR controller logs with Justin Houston and determined catastrophic disk failures prevented recordings after July 29, 2019.

persons.name: Mike Beaudin
persons.context: Was provided access to the beginning sectors of 16 drives to investigate potential clues of a system rebuild.

connections.description: Collaborated on reviewing DVR controller logs to assess system failures.
Both were involved in the technical investigation of the DVR system's disk failures.

events.title: DVR System Investigation Meeting
events.description: A meeting was conducted with DVR vendor SigNet Technologies to investigate catastrophic disk failures in a surveillance system.

events.title: DVR System Failure Date
events.description: The date after which no recordings would have been available due to catastrophic disk failures in the DVR array.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor, New York, NY 10004
keyFacts: A DVR system experienced catastrophic disk failures, resulting in no available recordings after July 29, 2019.
Technical experts found no apparent clues indicating a possible rebuild of the system from the 16 drives examined.
The investigation was conducted by the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General, New York Field Office.
